contents: Article 3 (Requirements for Membership) ① Sports organizations wishing to join the Sports Association as a member sports organization must meet the following requirements. 1. It must be a nationally representative sports organization. 2. The sports must meet the requirements for sports in accordance with Article 2, Paragraph 1 of the National Sports Promotion Act. 3. It must be a sports organization whose authority and leadership over the nation are recognized. 4. Three or more city/provincial sports organizations must be affiliated with the relevant member city/provincial sports association. 5. Competitions hosted by the city/provincial sports organizations under item 4 must be held at least once a year. 6. Popularity and performance of the relevant sports. Development potential must be recognized 7. The articles of association of the sports organization must be established in accordance with the Articles of Association of the Sports Council and the ‘Regulations of Member Sports Organizations’ 8. International Federation (IF) or Asian Olympics recognized by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) The organization must be a member of the Asian Games Confederation (AF) recognized by the Council (OCA). However, exceptions may be made depending on the characteristics of the event or organization. ② The first level of a sports organization that joins as a member sports organization of the Sports Council is a recognized organization. ③ Notwithstanding paragraph 2, if a city/provincial sports organization with four or more Olympic Games sports or one or more Asian Games sports is affiliated with the relevant member city/provincial sports association, it may apply for membership as an associate member organization. ④ Even if the subject of membership deliberation meets the requirements of paragraph 1, the Sports Association may not approve membership if the necessity of joining a member sports organization is not sufficiently recognized. ⑤ A member sports organization that has been confirmed to be an associate member organization or higher must become a corporation affiliated with the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism.
